about_the_game:
Voyage

  • In the game, you will control a spaceship to freely explore space, exploring various space systems, negotiating, trading, completing missions, and even fighting with various racial forces.

  • During the game, you can search for planets or interstellar space stations to achieve modular modification of your spaceship, constantly strengthening it and equipping it with various weapons.

  • The map of the entire game is endless, and the distance between various space systems is extremely far, so you can achieve ultra long distance navigation through "wormholes", "space jumps", or the spacecraft's built-in "super pulse engine".

  • There are several extremely powerful enemies hidden in the game that can only be seen under specific conditions, waiting for your challenge.

  • You can assemble your own fleet and challenge formidable enemies.

Spaceship Edit System

The spaceship editing system may be the biggest gameplay of this game, with up to 120+spaceship modules and 70+weapon modules available for you to use. This system allows you to piece together various spaceship modules like "building blocks", so you can easily create a unique spaceship.

  • Independent modules: Each spacecraft module has its own independent "health", "armor" and other information. The attack on the spacecraft will be on one or more modules, rather than the entire spacecraft being damaged; After each module's "health" is depleted, it will dissipate like space junk, but it will also automatically repair and be firmly assembled on the spacecraft after repair.

  • Spacecraft Core: Each spacecraft can only have one "core". If the core is damaged, the entire spacecraft will disintegrate and become uncontrollable, ultimately becoming space debris and dissipating in space. Therefore, please protect the spacecraft core with thick armor.

  • Weapon system: The weapons of the spacecraft are also modularly assembled, and when multiple weapon modules are connected together, they can work in sequence and then emit effects that cannot be produced by a single weapon system; The connection of weapon modules can be achieved through a single line, or by branching out into multiple branches for connection. Even branches can intersect at a certain point, resulting in a myriad of effects.

  • Energy system: Various operations of the spacecraft require energy consumption, especially the launch of weapons. The more and longer the modules connected to the weapons, the more energy consumption will increase exponentially. Therefore, you need to install various energy manufacturing modules and storage modules on the spacecraft so that it can continuously launch weapons to protect the spacecraft.

  • Navigation system: If the spacecraft cannot move, it becomes a "target", so having a good navigation system is very necessary. You can carry various driving engines to make the spacecraft move, and with good operation, it is enough to achieve spacecraft drift.

Small Game

  • Racing mode: You can drive your spaceship and four other different spaceships to participate in an exciting space racing game. The map will be filled with various traps to hinder you. You can also use the weapon system equipped on the spaceship to attack each other and slow down the opponent's progress. Here, the core of the spacecraft will not be destroyed, but various systems of the spacecraft will be damaged, so it is difficult to evaluate who can win first place before reaching the finish line.

  • Free Battle Mode: In this mode, you can deploy many different spaceships in a closed environment and divide them into up to 8 different teams to achieve a smooth battle and compete to see who is stronger.

  • Campaign Mode: You can choose a preset map, control a specific spaceship to influence the overall situation on the battlefield, maneuver through numerous enemies, coordinate with teammates to capture fortresses, and ultimately achieve victory.
